name: Basic Shrimp Ceviche
author: Sadie Melgoza
summary: A hearty and healthy recipe passed down from my mother-in-law. This is truly a simple dish that requires no expertise. However, you will be the talk of the party! You can edit the recipe to taste and get as creative as you like. The key is to use authentic, wholesome basic ingredients with very little to no preservatives or additives.
ingredients: 4 pounds large shrimp -- thawed, peeled, deveined, and chopped into small pieces
½ cup cilantro, or to taste
½ cup ketchup, or to taste
1 dash hot sauce (such as Cholula®), or to taste
directions: Pour lime juice over shrimp so they are completely saturated and none are exposed
Chop tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, and cilantro into small pieces
Add to the pan with the shrimp
Peel and chop 3 oranges and add to the shrimp
Squeeze the juice of 1 orange into the mixture
Add ketchup and hot sauce and mix well
Taste, using a tortilla chip as a spoon
